verses.verse: Then sang <S%H7891><s%> Deborah <S%H1683><s%> and Barak <S%H1301><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Abinoam <S%H42><s%> on that <S%H1931><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>
Praise <S%H1288><s%> ye the LORD <S%H3068><s%> for the avenging <S%H6544><s%> <S%H6546><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> when the people <S%H5971><s%> willingly offered themselves. <S%H5068><s%>

Hear, <S%H8085><s%> O ye kings; <S%H4428><s%> give ear, <S%H238><s%> O ye princes; <S%H7336><s%> I, <S%H595><s%> even I, <S%H595><s%> will sing <S%H7891><s%> unto the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> I will sing <S%H2167><s%> praise to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

LORD, <S%H3068><s%> when thou wentest out <S%H3318><s%> of Seir, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8165><s%> when thou marchedst <S%H6805><s%> out of the field <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7704><s%> of Edom, <S%H123><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> trembled, <S%H7493><s%> and <S%H1571><s%> the heavens <S%H8064><s%> dropped, <S%H5197><s%> the clouds <S%H5645><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> dropped <S%H5197><s%> water. <S%H4325><s%>

The mountains <S%H2022><s%> melted <S%H5140><s%> from before <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> even that <S%H2088><s%> Sinai <S%H5514><s%> from before <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

In the days <S%H3117><s%> of Shamgar <S%H8044><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Anath, <S%H6067><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of Jael, <S%H3278><s%> the highways <S%H734><s%> were unoccupied, <S%H2308><s%> and the travelers <S%H1980><s%> <S%H5410><s%> walked <S%H1980><s%> through byways. <S%H734><s%> <S%H6128><s%>

The inhabitants of the villages <S%H6520><s%> ceased, <S%H2308><s%> they ceased <S%H2308><s%> in Israel, <S%H3478><s%> until that <S%H5704><s%> that I Deborah <S%H1683><s%> arose, <S%H7945><s%> <S%H6965><s%> that I arose <S%H6965><s%> a mother <S%H517><s%> in Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

They chose <S%H977><s%> new <S%H2319><s%> gods; <S%H430><s%> then <S%H227><s%> was war <S%H3901><s%> in the gates: <S%H8179><s%> was there a shield <S%H4043><s%> or spear <S%H7420><s%> seen <S%H7200><s%> among forty <S%H705><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> in Israel? <S%H3478><s%>

My heart <S%H3820><s%> is toward the governors <S%H2710><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> that offered themselves willingly <S%H5068><s%> among the people. <S%H5971><s%> Bless <S%H1288><s%> ye the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

Speak, <S%H7878><s%> ye that ride <S%H7392><s%> on white <S%H6715><s%> asses, <S%H860><s%> ye that sit <S%H3427><s%> in <S%H5921><s%> judgment, <S%H4055><s%> and walk <S%H1980><s%> by <S%H5921><s%> the way. <S%H1870><s%>

They that are delivered from the noise <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6963><s%> of archers <S%H2686><s%> in <S%H996><s%> the places of drawing water, <S%H4857><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> shall they rehearse <S%H8567><s%> the righteous acts <S%H6666><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> even the righteous acts <S%H6666><s%> toward the inhabitants of his villages <S%H6520><s%> in Israel: <S%H3478><s%> then <S%H227><s%> shall the people <S%H5971><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> go down <S%H3381><s%> to the gates. <S%H8179><s%>

Awake, <S%H5782><s%> awake, <S%H5782><s%> Deborah: <S%H1683><s%> awake, <S%H5782><s%> awake, <S%H5782><s%> utter <S%H1696><s%> a song: <S%H7892><s%> arise, <S%H6965><s%> Barak, <S%H1301><s%> and lead thy captivity captive, <S%H7617><s%> <S%H7628><s%> thou son <S%H1121><s%> of Abinoam. <S%H42><s%>

Then <S%H227><s%> he made him that remaineth <S%H8300><s%> have dominion <S%H7287><s%> over the nobles <S%H117><s%> among the people: <S%H5971><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> made me have dominion <S%H7287><s%> over the mighty. <S%H1368><s%>

Out of <S%H4480><s%> Ephraim <S%H669><s%> was there a root <S%H8328><s%> of them against Amalek; <S%H6002><s%> after <S%H310><s%> thee, Benjamin, <S%H1144><s%> among thy people; <S%H5971><s%> out of <S%H4480><s%> Machir <S%H4353><s%> came down <S%H3381><s%> governors, <S%H2710><s%> and out of Zebulun <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2074><s%> they that handle <S%H4900><s%> the pen <S%H7626><s%> of the writer. <S%H5608><s%>

And the princes <S%H8269><s%> of Issachar <S%H3485><s%> were with <S%H5973><s%> Deborah; <S%H1683><s%> even Issachar, <S%H3485><s%> and also <S%H3651><s%> Barak: <S%H1301><s%> he was sent <S%H7971><s%> on foot <S%H7272><s%> into the valley. <S%H6010><s%> For the divisions <S%H6391><s%> of Reuben <S%H7205><s%> there were great <S%H1419><s%> thoughts <S%H2711><s%> of heart. <S%H3820><s%>

Why <S%H4100><s%> abodest <S%H3427><s%> thou among <S%H996><s%> the sheepfolds, <S%H4942><s%> to hear <S%H8085><s%> the bleatings <S%H8292><s%> of the flocks? <S%H5739><s%> For the divisions <S%H6391><s%> of Reuben <S%H7205><s%> there were great <S%H1419><s%> searchings <S%H2714><s%> of heart. <S%H3820><s%>

Gilead <S%H1568><s%> abode <S%H7931><s%> beyond <S%H5676><s%> Jordan: <S%H3383><s%> and why <S%H4100><s%> did Dan <S%H1835><s%> remain <S%H1481><s%> in ships? <S%H591><s%> Asher <S%H836><s%> continued <S%H3427><s%> on the sea <S%H3220><s%> shore, <S%H2348><s%> and abode <S%H7931><s%> in <S%H5921><s%> his breaches. <S%H4664><s%>

Zebulun <S%H2074><s%> and Naphtali <S%H5321><s%> were a people <S%H5971><s%> that jeopardized <S%H2778><s%> their lives <S%H5315><s%> unto the death <S%H4191><s%> in <S%H5921><s%> the high places <S%H4791><s%> of the field. <S%H7704><s%>

The kings <S%H4428><s%> came <S%H935><s%> and fought, <S%H3898><s%> then <S%H227><s%> fought <S%H3898><s%> the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Canaan <S%H3667><s%> in Taanach <S%H8590><s%> by <S%H5921><s%> the waters <S%H4325><s%> of Megiddo; <S%H4023><s%> they took <S%H3947><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> gain <S%H1214><s%> of money. <S%H3701><s%>

They fought <S%H3898><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> heaven; <S%H8064><s%> the stars <S%H3556><s%> in their courses <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4546><s%> fought <S%H3898><s%> against <S%H5973><s%> Sisera. <S%H5516><s%>

The river <S%H5158><s%> of Kishon <S%H7028><s%> swept them away, <S%H1640><s%> that ancient <S%H6917><s%> river, <S%H5158><s%> the river <S%H5158><s%> Kishon. <S%H7028><s%> O my soul, <S%H5315><s%> thou hast trodden down <S%H1869><s%> strength. <S%H5797><s%>

Then <S%H227><s%> were the horses' <S%H5483><s%> hooves <S%H6119><s%> broken <S%H1986><s%> by the means of the prancings, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1726><s%> the prancings <S%H1726><s%> of their mighty ones. <S%H47><s%>

Curse <S%H779><s%> ye Meroz, <S%H4789><s%> said <S%H559><s%> the angel <S%H4397><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> curse ye bitterly <S%H779><s%> <S%H779><s%> the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> thereof; because <S%H3588><s%> they came <S%H935><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> to the help <S%H5833><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> to the help <S%H5833><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> against the mighty. <S%H1368><s%>

Blessed <S%H1288><s%> above women <S%H4480><s%> <S%H802><s%> shall Jael <S%H3278><s%> the wife <S%H802><s%> of Heber <S%H2268><s%> the Kenite <S%H7017><s%> be, blessed <S%H1288><s%> shall she be above women <S%H4480><s%> <S%H802><s%> in the tent. <S%H168><s%>
He asked <S%H7592><s%> water, <S%H4325><s%> and she gave <S%H5414><s%> him milk; <S%H2461><s%> she brought forth <S%H7126><s%> butter <S%H2529><s%> in a lordly <S%H117><s%> dish. <S%H5602><s%>

She put <S%H7971><s%> her hand <S%H3027><s%> to the nail, <S%H3489><s%> and her right hand <S%H3225><s%> to the workmen's <S%H6001><s%> hammer; <S%H1989><s%> and with the hammer she smote <S%H1986><s%> Sisera, <S%H5516><s%> she smote off <S%H4277><s%> his head, <S%H7218><s%> when she had pierced <S%H4272><s%> and stricken through <S%H2498><s%> his temples. <S%H7451><s%>

At <S%H996><s%> her feet <S%H7272><s%> he bowed, <S%H3766><s%> he fell, <S%H5307><s%> he lay down: <S%H7901><s%> at <S%H996><s%> her feet <S%H7272><s%> he bowed, <S%H3766><s%> he fell: <S%H5307><s%> where <S%H834><s%> he bowed, <S%H3766><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> he fell down <S%H5307><s%> dead. <S%H7703><s%>

The mother <S%H517><s%> of Sisera <S%H5516><s%> looked out <S%H8259><s%> at <S%H1157><s%> a window, <S%H2474><s%> and cried <S%H2980><s%> through <S%H1157><s%> the lattice, <S%H822><s%> Why <S%H4069><s%> is <S%H954><s%> his chariot <S%H7393><s%> so long <S%H954><s%> in coming? <S%H935><s%> why <S%H4069><s%> tarry <S%H309><s%> the wheels <S%H6471><s%> of his chariots? <S%H4818><s%>
Her wise <S%H2450><s%> ladies <S%H8282><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> her, yea, <S%H637><s%> she <S%H1931><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> answer <S%H561><s%> to herself,

Have they not <S%H3808><s%> sped? <S%H4672><s%> have they not divided <S%H2505><s%> the prey; <S%H7998><s%> to every <S%H7218><s%> man <S%H1397><s%> a damsel or two; <S%H7356><s%> <S%H7356><s%> to Sisera <S%H5516><s%> a prey <S%H7998><s%> of divers colors, <S%H6648><s%> a prey <S%H7998><s%> of divers colors <S%H6648><s%> of needlework, <S%H7553><s%> of divers colors <S%H6648><s%> of needlework <S%H7553><s%> on both sides, meet for the necks <S%H6677><s%> of them that take the spoil? <S%H7998><s%>

So <S%H3651><s%> let all <S%H3605><s%> thine enemies <S%H341><s%> perish, <S%H6><s%> O LORD: <S%H3068><s%> but let them that love <S%H157><s%> him be as the sun <S%H8121><s%> when he goeth forth <S%H3318><s%> in his might. <S%H1369><s%> And the land <S%H776><s%> had rest <S%H8252><s%> forty <S%H705><s%> years. <S%H8141><s%>
